channel.title: Godcard [Roleplay Thread]
channel.description:
Several figures, with two others in the lead, walked down a white, metallic corridor. Everyone was in a hurry. One of the figures was a young scientist in a white lab coat, glasses, with a notepad in one hand and a pen in the other. He had short black hair and blue eyes. Next to him, walked a prominent figure who looked like a businessman. "I sure am excited to finally get this started. This is my life's work and everyone who will know about it will be a few psychotic rascals running around throwing fireballs at each other," he chuckled.
The two walked in through a pair of automated doors into a bay full of trucks with a single exit for vehicles that led to above ground. The businessman and the rest made their way over to a wooden crate, as he presented the cards to the delivery team. He took a Black Card of King Arthur in his hands and said: "Gentlemen. This is our most ambitious project so far. Don't fuck it up," he put his cigarette back in his mouth as he spoke. "This card portrays... King Arthur of Camelot."
Suddenly, a bright light shined through in the room, as a sword adorned with golden trim appeared in the man's hand. "As you may already know, the cards offer magical abilities to the last person that touched them, but in order to help them develop - we need to give them to attuned users. I've already enchanted the scanners in your trucks. Your task is simple; deliver these cards to the right people," he put the King Arthur back in the box. "And no playing around with the powers - these are not toys. These are the way that mankind will regain contact with the Magic of Old... Now get moving!" he turned around and yelled.
Each delivery team took a small box of cards as well as scanners and got into their trucks. As the trucks' motor started, a woman in black appeared carrying a small box. "The agents are deployed, sir. They will help the card holders as planned"
The man nodded as he puffed another cloud of smoke from his cigarettes. "And the associate groups?"
"They have begin their distribution earlier as planned."
The man nodded absentmindedly. A new era of magic had begun. _____________________
*The RP starts with the character either receiving a package filled with their black card and an introduction card from Olympus Group at their house or they have previously received a card from an associate group (Like Anubis Organisation or Delphi Magic Group) and receive an introduction card from Olympus Group about the purpose of Black Cards.*

item.title: Godcard [Roleplay Thread]
item.dc:creator: Simon
item.description:
Sounds ominous. Should’ve expected that really…

But to get to why I’m here:
I know you don’t know much, but do you think it would be beneficial to try and communicate with the rose ghosts?

item.description:
"It is better not to ask if you plan to stay. "

Read full topic

item.title: Godcard [Roleplay Thread]
item.dc:creator: Simon
item.description:
Yeah, that’s fair I guess.
But it does point to souls not just fading into nothingness after they leave this place. So that bodes well.
You wouldn’t happen to remember where you were before here, would you?

Read full topic

item.title: Godcard [Roleplay Thread]
item.dc:creator: Damafaud
item.description:
@Marluxion
Rosarie raises an eyebrow.

“An interesting theory, yet non applicable. Staying on the mortal plane and returning to it are two different events altogether.”

To Jacob, Rosarie is speaking to empty air.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Godcard [Roleplay Thread]
item.dc:creator: Simon
item.description:
(Marcus is there too, right?)
(If so:)
I can actually explain part of that.
It is actually natural for almost everybody to remain for at least a short period of time after death, like an hour or so. But quite a bit of people remain longer than that, for weeks or months, or even years for some, after they die. They usually fade once they can rest easy, so to speak. Like, promising to feed their cat can do it, for instance. Although, usually they change into being quite self-centered/having almost total tunnel vision after they died. You seem to be fine, though, but that’s probably for the same reason you can make yourself visible to the living.

Read full topic

item.title: Godcard [Roleplay Thread]
item.dc:creator: Damafaud
item.description:
“How did the roses spirit go rampage? How could we keep our consciousness? How did Julia obtain the power to distort this mansion?”

He shakes his head.

“There are many things she won’t tell to us. Maybe you can fare better. She’s currently at the balcony, right from here.”

Read full topic

item.title: Godcard [Roleplay Thread]
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
“But… how?”

Read full topic

item.title: Godcard [Roleplay Thread]
item.dc:creator: Damafaud
item.description:
"… I think we need to clarify some crucial points. "
He turns to face Jacob.
"The only reason this whole household and myself still roam this mansion is because of my daughter. "
He pauses.
“We were already gone from this world… but her spirit called us back.”

Read full topic

"It is of no concequences. We can’t let innocent people get slaughtered by the roses, can we? " He gives them a smile.
